direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the set, but one operates on an index while the other operates on an object.
Both methods handle the removal of elements from the set, but removeAll removes all elements that are present in the provided collection.
Both methods involve removing elements based on a condition, but removeIf uses a predicate to determine which elements to remove.
Both methods modify the set by removing elements, but retainAll removes elements that are not in the provided collection.
Both methods involve modifying the set by removing elements, but clear removes all elements from the set.
Both methods modify the set, but add inserts elements while remove deletes them.
